covered: Valid Request: TC01, TC02 cover standard successful updates with valid payloads and headers.
Partial Update: TC19 covers updating only provided fields.
Non-Existing Resource: TC08 covers behavior when account does not exist (though expected status in story is 400 per test).
Concurrency Issues: TC17 covers concurrent updates to the same account.
Invalid Payload / Data Validation: TC07 covers invalid account data; TC09 covers unauthorized scenarios; TC06 covers invalid accountId format.
System Error Handling: TC12 covers database/unavailability scenarios (500).
Empty Request Body / Missing Required Fields: TC11 covers empty body leading to 400.
Unauthorized Access: TC09 covers missing/invalid authentication (401).
Extra Optional Fields: TC10 covers extra/unsupported fields handling.
Treatment of treatNullAsReset: TC03 and TC04 cover behavior with null fields and treatNullAsReset toggle.
Large Payloads: TC13 covers large payloads.
Slow Network / Timeouts: TC14 covers latency/timeout scenarios.
Query Parameters and Extra Parameters: TC03/T C04 include treatNullAsReset; TC22 covers extra query parameters.
Minimum/Maximum Values: TC20 covers boundary values for fields.
Security - Injection: TC18 covers malicious input handling.
Regression - Partial Field Update Integrity: TC15 ensures updating email does not overwrite other fields.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting or burst control.
Pagination: Not applicable for single-resource PUT, but no explicit coverage to confirm behavior with large prior datasets (not strictly required for PUT).
Authorization Edge Case: Although TC09 covers unauthorized access, there is no explicit test ensuring 403 vs 401 distinction across all scenarios.
Non-Standard Status for Non-Existence: Test suite uses 400 for non-existent resource (TC08); guideline mentions standard 404 in places, so ambiguity remains.
recommendations: Add tests for caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) to verify proper caching semantics and revalidation.
Add rate limiting/throttling tests to ensure API handles bursts or high request rates gracefully.
Consider explicit 404 vs 400 distinction for non-existent resources and align with guideline expectations.
Introduce explicit authorization coverage across more scenarios (e.g., token expiry, insufficient scopes) and ensure consistent 401/403 handling.
Include a dedicated test for pagination-related edge cases if any GET-like retrievals are introduced in related stories, to ensure no unintended effects on PUT.
